title: Keepin' silent
creator_contributor_role: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia, production company
subject_group: Crime, Espionage, Justice, Police & Prisons/Kelly, Ned, 1855-1880
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Torres Strait Islanders
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures - Australia - History
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Advertising - Australia - History
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Lyell, Lottie
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Country life - Australia
abstract: Melbourne Cup Day (1896, 4 mins)--Torres Strait Island (1898, 4 mins)--The Story of the Kelly Gang (fragments) (1906, 9 mins)-- Pathe Newsreel: The Ballarat Kennel Club (1912, 3 mins)--Cinema Advertising for Lasker and Lasker Bathing Suits (1925, 2 mins)--Australian Gazette: Cartoons of the Moment: The War Zoo (c1915, 4 mins)--The Charmed Cup (1929, 8 mins)--The Sentimental Bloke (excerpt) (1919, 9 mins)--Beautiful Lines of Women Triumphant (1920s, 3 mins)--The Adventures of Dot (1927, 15 mins)--Beautiful Middle Harbour (1928, 11 mins)--Bert Hinkler arrives in Melbourne (1928, 3 mins)--Country Life (1928-, 25 mins)--Sheep to Shop (1920s, 11 mins).
description: This compilation of footage from Australia's silent era (1896-1930) encompasses examples of actuality, documentary, newsreels, home movies, advertisements, animation, narrative shorts and features. With piano accompaniment by Mrs Betty Magner.
